clinical_study.official_title: Safety of Intravenous Lidocaine Infusions for Chronic Neuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to prospectively determine the side effects profile in adults with neuropathic pain receiving intravenous infusions of lidocaine 5 mg per kg of lean body weight, infused over 45 minutes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligibility Criteria:
Adults > 18 yrs with chronic central or peripheral neuropathic pain at the St Joseph's Health Care Pain Clinic between June and December 2009.
Outcome measures: All side effects spontaneously reported. Sedation, nausea, dizziness by Visual Analog Score Q 15 minutes; hemodynamic data q 5 minutes during and after infusion for 30 minutes.
Daily diary of side effects and Visual Analogue score of Pain for 7 days post-infusion.

arm_group.description: Adults >18 yrs , attending St Joseph's Health Care Pain Clinic with a diagnosis of chronic neuropathic pain who are being treated with an lidocaine infusion of 5 mg/kg over 45 minutes Consecutive patients from two time periods: June 15 to August 21, 2009 October 15-Dec 22,2009

study_pop.textblock: Adult outpatients attending St Joseph's Chronic Pain Clinic in one of two time periods who have been diagnosed with chronic neuropathic pain by clinical history and examination and are scheduled to receive a lidocaine infusion for pain management

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult outpatients > 18 years < 80 years diagnosed with chronic neuropathic pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide informed consent
- Unable to speak and understand English
- Liver, kidney, or cardiac failure
- Allergy to Lidocaine
